title: TypeScript Progression Ladder
subtitle: The TypeScript progression ladder (TSPL) is a grouping of concepts and skills relevant to TypeScript programming. TSPL provides aspiring TypeScript programmers with a way to track and improve their TypeScript skills.

topics.name: Type inference
topics.description: Understand how TS automatically identifies the type of a variable or object

topics.name: Type annotations
topics.description: Delcare the types of a variable or object when the type inferance system is not enough

topics.name: Primitive types
topics.description: Declare and work with basic types

topics.name: Non-nullable types
topics.description: Avoid potential error by making null and undefined explicit

topics.name: Structural type system
topics.description: Undertand the difference with a nominal type system and the type compability rules

topics.name: Function declarations & function expressions
topics.description: Understand the differences between function expressions and declarations

notes: Please note: some of the preceding topics such as promises are not only relevant to TypeScript (as they are also relevant to JavaScript). These topics have been included because we asume that a novice reader has no previous experince with both JavaScript and TypeScript
